titlestmt.titleproper: Mary Gray letters from the Magnetic Medical Institute 1900-1900
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Mary Gray letters from the Magnetic Medical Institute

bioghist.p: The Magnetic Medical Institute of Grand Rapids, Michigan, established in 1882, was a patent medicine firm that specialized in "treating patients by mail."

scopecontent.p: The collection contains letters sent from the Magnetic Medical Institute of Grand Rapids, Michigan, to Mary Gray, of Rural Ridge, Pennsylvania, from May to August of 1900. The letters offer a diagnosis of her health and offer a treatment regimen for her to follow.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
